steps.title: Draw a side of the square using ruler.
steps.content: Draw a side of the square using ruler. Keep track of the length of this side so you can make all four sides the same length.

steps.title: Considering the side drawn in the previous step as one of the arms, construct a right angle on each end of it.
steps.content: Considering the side drawn in the previous step as one of the arms, construct a right angle on each end of it. Thus the end points of the side drawn in the previous step would also be the two vertices of these right angles. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mark a point on each of the newly drawn arms (of the two right angles), at a distance (measured from the respective vertex of the right angle) which is same as the length of the side drawn initially.
steps.content: Mark a point on each of the newly drawn arms (of the two right angles), at a distance (measured from the respective vertex of the right angle) which is same as the length of the side drawn initially. [2] X Research source Join these two points.

steps.title: You just drew a perfect square!
steps.content: You just drew a perfect square! Erase any extraneous constructions if you so wish.

steps.title: Construct a right angle (let's name it LMN) as described here.
steps.content: Construct a right angle (let's name it LMN) as described here . Ensure that each of the arms are longer than the desired side length of the square.

steps.title: Place spike of the compass on the vertex of the right angle constructed in the previous step, i.e. on the point M, and set the width of the compass equal to the desired side length of the square - this set width remains unchanged until the entire construction is completed.
steps.content: Place spike of the compass on the vertex of the right angle constructed in the previous step, i .e. on the point M, and set the width of the compass equal to the desired side length of the square - this set width remains unchanged until the entire construction is completed. [3] X Research source Draw an arc cutting the arm MN at some point (say P) Draw another arc to cut the arm LM at some point (say Q)

steps.title: Place the spike of the compass on point Q and draw an arc somewhere below the arm MN.
steps.content: Place the spike of the compass on point Q and draw an arc somewhere below the arm MN. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place the spike of the compass on point P and draw another arc which cuts the arc drawn in the previous step at some point (say R).
steps.content: Place the spike of the compass on point P and draw another arc which cuts the arc drawn in the previous step at some point (say R). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Connect the points P and R and the points Q and R using a straightedge.
steps.content: Connect the points P and R and the points Q and R using a straightedge. [6] X Research source The figure PMQR is a square. You may erase other unnecessary constructions if you so wish.
